definition: to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while

sentences.english: You can duck, shimmering tactfully, that I will not stop for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 任你梨渦淺笑，波光婉轉，我也不會再停歇片刻。

sentences.english: When Jiang did not break, Faye to embrace, at this time.
sentences.chinese: 蟬啼叫還沒有停歇，鴻雁欲過，此時的懷抱是悲傷的。

sentences.english: Since then, the people has never stopped to research on the advertising agency system.
sentences.chinese: 從此，人們對廣告代理制的研究就從未停歇。

sentences.english: What lauguage is thine, oh sea?The lauguage of eternal question.
sentences.chinese: 海以不停歇的質問來表達，天空則通過永恆的沉默。

sentences.english: The troops rested in the woods.
He can fire off spells all day and never get tired.
sentences.chinese: 進入魔井的人可以不停歇施放魔法而不會感到疲憊。

sentences.english: There must come a full pause to weave perfection into music.
sentences.chinese: 必須有一段完全的停歇，好把“圓滿”編進音樂。

sentences.english: The bird-chorus has run out of breath.

sentences.chinese: 久已沉默的停歇的時間。

sentences.english: Environmental protection is non-stop work, but as long as there is still progress to.
sentences.chinese: 環保是永不停歇的工作，但只要有努力還是有進步的。

sentences.english: For the first time she seemed to be taking a rest from the tiring act of thought.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎是她平生第一次因爲厭倦了思考而停歇下來。

sentences.english: Changgou Village in Qiqihaar City, China is the stopover site of Hooded Crane.
sentences.chinese: 齊齊哈爾市鐵峯區長溝村是白頭鶴南北遷徙的停歇地。

sentences.english: During this melancholy pause, the turnkey read his newspaper with a waggish look.
sentences.chinese: 在這個憂鬱的停歇期間，看守滑稽地閱讀著報紙。

definition: to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
with a grunting sound it stops (idiom); to come to an end spontaneously (esp. of sound)
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
